body: @ascrutae Do you know why?

See more detail about [IllegalDataFileException](https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-integration-testtool/blob/master/docs/exception/IllegalDataFileException.md), and I had check the build log and found all test cases build failed.
Ok. I will update the support list after reviewing the test cases today

Here is the [test report](http://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/9/stalary/testReport-master-2019-09-03-08-46.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/271/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-09-03-08-46.log)
thanks,I've already seen the source code, may I use the plugin(apm-spring-cloud-gateway-2.1.x-plugin) for skywalking6.2.0 now?
@stalary We are checking our test env. Look like something wrong there.
@wu-sheng  Ok, I'm also running the local tests

As far as I known, no one is facing this in committer team. I think you have to do some research on es about why. This is an es error.
This is good improvement. Contributions are welcome.

@ascrutae @kezhenxu94 @zhaoyuguang Could anyone of you verify this PR locally? This is the last PR of 6.4.0 milestone. I will initialize release tests to the committer and community after this PR confirmed(merged).
@zpc870921 you can use nssm https://www.cnblogs.com/TianFang/p/7912648.html

@wu-sheng @candyleer  I tried (including the case when the method is also annotated with Transactional - check if it will affect transaction),didn't find side effect . mainly because when introducing into tracing system, biz application developers has concerns about the unstable factor . if consider it is not big issue then close is ok .
I changed the changlog, please reciew again.

Should i pr with a new brach?This pr is messy because of my rebase
Do the thing you think better. You don't need our permissionðŸ˜„
Today, we don't have a consistent mechanism to deal with this. You could only do that by changing plugin source codes. For me, using Exception to propagate error is easy but not good practice.
I am not sure why this happens, coordinator bug?

https://github.com/eirslett/frontend-maven-plugin/issues/548

I found this issue to be helpful in resolving it

the package by eirslett referenced in skywalking (and many other applications) is specifically problematic for many users and the solution is obfuscated by the error messaging.

> Today, we don't have a consistent mechanism to deal with this. You could only do that by changing plugin source codes. For me, using Exception to propagate error is easy but not good practice.

Thanks!
ok, I  waill finish.

Can you describe the requirements in detail?If you can, please take a screenshot, thank you!
@zhaoxunyong
ok, I will finish.

I think manual extension is not convenient. It is better to add a button to pop up a dialog box large enough. What do you think?
@zhaoxunyong

> I think manual extension is not convenient. It is better to add a button to pop up a dialog box large enough. What do you think?
> @zhaoxunyong

Or add a button that automatically changes the box to the size of the content and retracts to its original size.
But agent doesn't need to.

Now we have a problem here, that is, multiple dubbo services are connected to agent. One dubbo service relies on other dubbo services. When tracking the link, it is found that collector cannot connect multiple dubbo services connected to agent.
I remembered the previous version seems to have a right arrow on the top right corner, I can expand it horizontally.

It's good idea~

Now we have a problem here, that is, multiple dubbo services are connected to agent. One dubbo service relies on other dubbo services. When tracking the link, it is found that collector cannot connect multiple dubbo services connected to agent.

Static method is supported We have enhanced already in the existing plugin. You could search the codes easily. As it is your private class, you have to find out why by yourself.
We don't support that. It is very dangerous in production env, highly recommend don't use in this way.
okï¼Œthanks
I am not following your meaning. This API is even not designed for java agent side.
Read master, `gRPCThreadPoolSize` and `gRPCThreadPoolQueueSize` configs are provided today.
`DEADLINE_EXCEEDED` is a standard fail-safe mechanism, a.k.a. timeout, meaning your OAP server doesn't reply in time.
move to #3410

@stone-wlg if it's not absolutely necessary, just push to the original branch and you don't need to open pull requests over and over again, learn how to merge from upstream repository and update a pull request

> @stone-wlg if it's not absolutely necessary, just push to the original branch and you don't need to open pull requests over and over again, learn how to merge from upstream repository and update a pull request

ok, but i do not want to leave unnecessary log in git log.
@xsisno1 If you are keeping talking in Chinese, I will stop to reply. It is on Apache repo and issue, we should use English.

> @xsisno1 If you are keeping talking in Chinese, I will stop to reply. It is on Apache repo and issue, we should use English.

We now have a problem with two dubbo services, one of which calls the other dubbo service, and we see in skywalking-ui that both dubbo services are registered with collectors, but on the topology diagram we see that the two dubbo services do not generate a calling relationship, and new nodes are created in the call chain. So you can't really do full link monitoring.
@zhaoxunyong see https://github.com/apache/skywalking-rocketbot-ui/pull/152
@wu-sheng cloud you please do a hotfix on 6.3.0, just compared master and 6.3.0, too many changes made, hard to fix the issue

> @zhaoxunyong see [apache/skywalking-rocketbot-ui#152](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-rocketbot-ui/pull/152)

Great, you're so efficient!
Why is there no link tracking on the UI after this error occurs in my service, only interacting with Eureka?
I also have no link display after restarting the service.
Has the agent been upgraded? Because the protocol upgrades at 6.2.
the agent had updated

> Do you reconsider the AsyncSpan, because the plugin throw NullPointerException when I print logs in a scheduler.
> 
> ```java
> @Component
> public class MyFilter implements WebFilter {
> 
>     @Override
>     public Mono<Void> filter(ServerWebExchange exchange, WebFilterChain chain) {
>         return chain.filter(new MyServerWebExchangeDecorator(exchange));
>     }
> 
>     public static class MyServerWebExchangeDecorator extends ServerWebExchangeDecorator {
> 
>         private MyServerHttpRequestDecorator requestDecorator;
> 
>         public MyServerWebExchangeDecorator(ServerWebExchange delegate) {
>             super(delegate);
>             requestDecorator = new MyServerHttpRequestDecorator(delegate.getRequest());
>         }
> 
>         @Override
>         public ServerHttpRequest getRequest() {
>             return requestDecorator;
>         }
>     }
> 
>     public static class MyServerHttpRequestDecorator extends ServerHttpRequestDecorator {
> 
>         public MyServerHttpRequestDecorator(ServerHttpRequest delegate) {
>             super(delegate);
>         }
> 
>         @Override
>         public Flux<DataBuffer> getBody() {
>             // using a scheduler
>             return super.getBody().publishOn(Schedulers.elastic()).map(dataBuffer -> printBody(dataBuffer));
>         }
> 
>         private DataBuffer printBody(DataBuffer dataBuffer) {
>             // print body
>             return dataBuffer;
>         }
>     }
> 
> }
> 
> @RestController
> public class HelloController {
> 
>     @PostMapping("/hello")
>     public Mono<String> hello(@RequestBody String body) {
>         // do something with body
>         return Mono.just("Hello World");
>     }
> 
> }
> ```
> 
> and the NullPointerException:

> CompletableFuture.supplyAsync

## Short answer is NO.

## Long version:

`CompletableFuture` is a JDK class, for now, the only one supported JDK class is `HttpURLConnection`, see #3171

package cn.swt;

import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;
import org.springframework.cloud.client.discovery.EnableDiscoveryClient;

@EnableDiscoveryClient
@SpringBootApplication
public class GatewayApplication {

		SpringApplication.run(GatewayApplication.class, args);
	}

}

                <scope>import</scope>
            </dependency>
            <dependency>
                
                <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>

    </dependencyManagement>
    <build>
        <plugins>

    </build>
</project>
